intro: Primula microdonta, commonly known as the dwarf primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually oval-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
